name: HCCGo BLAST Tutorial
description: Running BLAST Queries using single and multi-node configurations, and running BLAST against a custom database

submits.commands:
#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1

# change directory to the correct location
cd $WORK/blast-tutorial

# copy query and database files to temp folder
cp $BLAST/nt.00.* /tmp
cp yeast.nt.fasta /tmp

# run BLAST using query yeast.nt.fasta against entire nucleotide database
blastn -db /tmp/nt.00 -query /tmp/yeast.nt.fasta -out /tmp/blast_nt_single.alignments

# copy results from temp directory
cp /tmp/blast_nt_single.alignments .

#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1

# change directory to the correct location
cd $WORK/blast-tutorial

# copy query and database files to temp folder
cp $BLAST/nt.00.* /tmp
cp yeast.nt.fasta /tmp

# run BLAST using query yeast.nt.fasta against the entire nucleotide database
blastn -db /tmp/nt.00 -query /tmp/yeast.nt.fasta -out /tmp/blast_nt_multi.alignments -num_threads $SLURM_NTASKS_PER_NODE

# copy results from temp directory
cp /tmp/blast_nt_multi.alignments .

#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1

# change directory to the correct location
cd $WORK/blast-tutorial

# copy query and database files to temp folder
cp yeast.aa /tmp
cp yeast.aa.fasta /tmp

# make BLAST database from yeast.aa file
makeblastdb -n /tmp/yeast.aa -dbtype prot -out /tmp/yeast.aa.db

# run BLAST using query yeast.nt.fasta against the created database
blastn -db /tmp/yeast.aa.db -query /tmp/yeast.aa.fasta -out /tmp/blast_aa_multi.alignments -num_threads $SLURM_NTASKS_PER_NODE

# copy results from temp directory
cp /tmp/blast_aa_multi.alignments .
